I used to work for a couple of sign companies and even ran my own for awhile. You applied the vinyl completely wrong. What you should have done is remove the backing from one end, say a few inches, attach it, then slowly pull the backing off while smoothing the vinyl onto your surface. You can use a credit card if you don't have a squeegee (vinyl applicator) to smooth down the vinyl to the substrate (surface).

Regardless, it came out very nicely. Great job! :-)

Sorry.  The maker of this fireplace insert recommends to keep all combustible materials at least three feet away from the unit.  It is not appropriate for the faux fireplace you have created.  Both the paper backing and styrofoam could ignite.  This fireplace insert produces 1,350 watts of heat (4,600 BTU/hr.).  "The fire within" could burn your home down.
